title: Several spells of showers expected today in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers are expected in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (30), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: University lecturers to launch strike today over several issues
byline: The Federation of University Teachers’ Associations (FUTA) has announced that university lecturers will engage in strike action today (30) due to the government’s continued failure to resolve the pressing issues within the university system.

title: Govt aims to expand Sri Lanka’s digital economy to USD 15 billion: PM Harini
byline: The foundation for realizing Sri Lanka’s vision of entering the digital era is developing the human resource that is compatible with modern technology and a significant focus was drawn in this regard in the ongoing educational reforms, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Three Sri Lankans involved in crimes arrested in Bengaluru
byline: Three Sri Lankans who were allegedly involved in crimes have been arrested by the Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru.

title: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu agree new Gaza peace plan
byline: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu say they have agreed a new peace plan for Gaza, warning Hamas to accept it.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who faces allegations of offenses under the Public Property Act, has been further remanded until October 14 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Another stock of drugs seized in raid in Mattakkuliya
byline: An individual has been arrested by the Colombo North Division Crimes Investigation Unit along with a stock of hashish, heroin and narcotic pills, police stated.

title: Actress Nicole Kidman and musician Keith Urban split after nearly two decades together
byline: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have reportedly separated after nearly two decades together.

title: Bodies of two males found in separate areas of Colombo
byline: Bodies of two males have been found in two separate locations in Colombo, according to police.

title: YouTube to pay $24.5 million to settle Trump account suspension suit
byline: Alphabet-owned YouTube has agreed to pay $24.5 million to settle a lawsuit that US President Donald Trump brought against the company over the suspension of his account following the January 2021 U.S. Capitol riots, a court filing showed on Monday.

title: Temporary Driver’s licences now issued from Nugegoda Medical Institute
byline: The temporary driver’s licence issued during the renewal process will now be provided by the National Transport Medical Institute in Nugegoda, effective today (30), the Department of Motor Traffic has announced.

title: Gold hits fresh record above $3,800 on US shutdown fears
byline: Gold edged higher to a fresh record as the prospect of a looming US government shutdown clouded the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy path ahead of next month’s interest-rate decision.

title: Mahatma Gandhi statue vandalised in London, Indian Mission condemns violent act
byline: The High Commission of India has strongly condemned the vandalism of Mahatma Gandhi’s statue at Tavistock Square in London on Monday, just days before the annual Gandhi Jayanti celebrations are scheduled to be held at the site on October 2.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division SSP Sathish Gamage granted bail
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Sathish Gamage, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Issuance of bus tickets in Western Province mandatory from tomorrow: WPRPTA
byline: The issuance of travel tickets to private bus passengers will be mandatory from tomorrow (Oct. 1), the Chairman of the Road Passenger Authority of the Western Province, Gamini Jasinghe stated.

title: Madagascar president dissolves government after ‘Gen Z’ protests
byline: Madagascar’s president has said he will dissolve his government, following days of youth-led protests over longstanding water and power cuts.

title: Lecturers’ strike hampers academic activities at major state universities
byline: The one-day strike launched by the Federation of University Teachers’ Associations (FUTA) is currently underway at all state universities across the country.

title: Trump visa curbs push US firms to consider shifting more work to India
byline: US President Donald Trump’s H-1B visa crackdown will hasten United States firms’ shift of critical work to India, turbocharging the growth of global capability centres that handle operations from finance to research and development, economists and industry insiders say.

title: Sri Lanka to develop globally recognized National Quality Infrastructure System
byline: Sri Lanka will soon develop a national quality infrastructure system that meets high international recognition standards, according to Minister of Science and Technology Dr. Chrishantha Abeysena.

title: Three injured in bus-lorry accident on A9 road in Mihintale
byline: Three individuals have sustained injuries in a road accident reported along A9 road in the Mihintale-Palugaswewa area.

title: ‘Total internet blackout’ in Afghanistan sparks panic
byline: The Taliban government in Afghanistan has imposed a nationwide shutdown of telecommunications, weeks after it began severing fibre-optic internet connections.

title: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera granted bail
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera, who was in remand custody over allegations of preparing forged documents to sell state-owned land, has been granted bail by the Gampaha High Court.

title: Ten hand grenades found in a bag at Modara
byline: The Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) has recovered a bag containing ten hand grenades at Aluthmawatha Road in Modara, police said.

title: Appeals court issues directive on vehicles detained by Sri Lanka Customs
byline: The Court of Appeal today (30) ordered Sri Lanka Customs to investigate and report to court by October 10, whether the vehicles currently being detained by Customs can be released on a corporate or personal bond.

title: Chinese woman convicted in UK after ‘world’s biggest’ bitcoin seizure
byline: A Chinese national has been convicted of playing a key role in what is believed to be the single largest cryptocurrency seizure in the world, worth more than £5bn ($6.7bn).

title: Over 40 students hospitalized following sudden illness during ‘Shramadana’
byline: More than 40 students of the Medirigiriya National School were admitted to the Medirigiriya Base Hospital this morning (30) after suddenly falling ill during a Shramadana campaign.

title: Colombo inflation climbs to 1.5% in September
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to 1.5% in September 2025, compared to 1.2% in August 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Minister Sunil Handunneththi admits mistakenly referring to Guinness Record as Nobel Prize
byline: Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi says that his reference to a ‘Nobel Prize’ instead of a ‘Guinness World Record’ when commenting on a recent tea auction in Japan was a mistake on his part.

title: Car bomb kills 10 in Pakistan after militants trigger shootout with troops
byline: A powerful car bomb killed 10 people in Pakistan after exploding outside the paramilitary security forces’ headquarters.

title: Derana Dream Star runner-up Nuwandhika Senarathne to perform national anthem at Women’s World Cup opening ceremony
byline: Nuwandhika Senarathne, the first runner-up of Season 9 of the Derana Dream Star singing competition, has been given the honor of singing the Sri Lankan national anthem at the opening ceremony of the 2025 Women’s One Day International (ODI) Cricket World Cup, today (30).

title: SC dismisses FR petition seeking to invalidate Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s MP seat
byline: The Supreme Court today dismissed a Fundamental Rights petition filed by former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, which sought a ruling to invalidate the election of former Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardena as a Member of Parliament for the Kalutara District at the last General Election.

title: Gaming giant Electronic Arts bought in unprecedented $55bn deal
byline: Electronic Arts (EA), one of the biggest gaming companies in the world, has agreed a deal to sell the company for $55bn (£41bn).

title: Two arrested with cocaine worth Rs. 150 million in Panadura
byline: Two suspects were arrested in the Hirana area of Panadura by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad while in possession of 03 kg of cocaine, valued at around Rs. 150 million, police said.

title: President invites Japanese business community to explore Sri Lanka’s emerging economic opportunities
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake invited the Japanese business community to join in exploring the emerging economic opportunities in Sri Lanka, while further strengthening bilateral trade and investment relations between Japan and Sri Lanka and encouraging private sector participation.

title: Heavy traffic in Colombo due to protest by uni. students
byline: Ward Place in Colombo 07 has reportedly been blocked for vehicular traffic due to a protest march by university students.

title: ‘Kajja’ linked to murder of Wasim Thajudeen?
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that it has been confirmed that Anura Vidanagamage, also known as “Kajja”, who was recently shot dead along with his two children in Middeniya, was in the vehicle that had followed slain former Sri Lankan rugby player Wasim Thajudeen’s vehicle moments before the latter was murdered.

title: Vance says US ‘headed to a shutdown’ after meeting with Democrats
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Democratic opponents appeared to make little progress at a White House meeting aimed at heading off a government shutdown that could disrupt a wide range of services as soon as Wednesday.

title: Sri Lanka Tourism responds to reports over LGBTQ+ tourism
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Tourism today denied that the Government has decided to run a specific tourism promotion campaign targeting LGBTQ+ foreign tourists while emphasizing that any future initiatives will be carefully evaluated within the framework of national tourism priorities and social harmony.

title: Chief Prelates write to President over LGBTQ tourism and corporal punishment ban
byline: The Chief Prelates of all three Buddhist Chapters emphasized that proposed amendments to the Penal Code introducing an offence for corporal punishment, as well as government initiatives to promote tourism through LGBTQ-related activities, could undermine cultural values and give rise to serious social catastrophes.

title: Australia updates student visa evidence levels: Sri Lanka now among low-risk countries
byline: The Australian Department of Home Affairs has recently updated evidence levels for student visa applications, as noted via the PRISMS system.

title: Fuel prices reduced
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (30).
